title: ProActive
text: ProActive automatically detects regions gapped elevated read coverage using pattern-matching algorithm. ProActive can detect, characterize visualize read coverage patterns genomes metagenomes. Optionally, users may provide gene predictions associated genome metagenome form .gff file. case, ProActive generate additional output table containing gene predictions found within detected regions gapped elevated read coverage. Analyzing coverage data important gaps elevations coverage can provide insight community’s (metagenome) organism’s (genome) genetic activity, example- Elevations read coverage can indication highly active /abundant mobile genetic elements (MGEs). MGEs actively replicating highly abundant may generate sequencing reads rest host bacterium’s genome thus creating region elevated read coverage element’s insertion site(s). Gaps read coverage can indicate heterogeneity bacterial genome sequence. Subpopulations bacteria without specific gene sequence may form gaps dips mapped read coverages. Genetic regions high mutation rates may also generate gaps read coverage. Note read coverage pattern-matching imployed ProActive good provided data. non-biological situations can create gaps elevations read coverage. example, chimeric assemblies contaminants can create odd read coverage artifacts. , ProActive best used screening method identify genetic regions investigation.

title: ProActive
text: ’d like thank Dr. Manuel Kleiner expertise overall support throughout development ProActive!

title: ProActive
code: if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") }  pak::pak("jlmaier12/ProActive") library(ProActive)

title: ProActive
text: ProActive detects read coverage patterns using pattern-matching algorithm operates pileup files. pileup file file format row summarizes ‘pileup’ reads specific genomic locations. Pileup files can used generate rolling mean read coverages associated base pair positions reduces data size preserving read coverage patterns. ProActive requires input pileups files generated using 100 bp window/bin size. Pileup files can generated either mapping sequencing reads metagenome genome .fasta file. Read mapping performed using high minimum identity (0.97 higher) random mapping ambiguous reads. pileup files needed ProActive generated using .bam files produced read mapping. read mappers, like BBMap, allow generation pileup files bbmap.sh command use bincov output covbinsize=100 parameter/argument. Otherwise, BBMap’s pileup.sh can convert .bam files produced read mapper pileup files using bincov output binsize=100. input pileup file metagenomes must following format: Pileup file must use 100 bp window/bin size rolling mean. Dataframe four columns: V1: Contig accession V2: Mapped read coverage values averaged 100 bp windows V3: Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. Restarts 100 start new contig. V4: Starting position (bp) 100 bp window. restart start new contig. Note format genome pileup slightly different! third column (V3) restart fourth column (V4) starts 0.

title: ProActive
text: ProActive optionally accepts .gff file input. .gff file must associated metagenome genome used create pileup file. .gff file TSV follow general format described .       (Hint- using gff file output PROKKA, may need remove unnecessary (ProActive) lines text top file. may able following command bash: ‘COMMONID’ value contig genome accession starts across rows. example, ‘COMMONID’ contig accessions sampleMetagenomegffTSV displayed “NODE” since accessions start “NODE”.

title: ProActive
text: ProActive() main function ProActive R package. function filters contigs/chunks based length read coverage, performs pattern-matching detect gaps elevations read coverage, identifies start stop positions sizes pattern-matches.

title: ProActive
text: Currently, ProActive() can detect one gap elevation pattern per contig. many cases, contigs one read coverage pattern, longer contig , greater chance multiple patterns. ProActive() able detect multiple read coverage patterns per contig, rely ‘chunking’ large contig smaller subsets (defined chunkSize) pattern-matching can performed chunk individual contig. chunking mechanism allows ProActive() pattern-match genomes. contigs/genomes chunked, assigned sequential value link chunks back together (.e. “NODE_1_chunk_1, NODE_1_chunk_2, NODE_1_chunk_3, …). Note remaining ‘chunk’ contig/genome may long enough perform pattern-matching . Chunks small pattern-matching get put output FilteredOut table.

title: ProActive
text: Contigs/chunks short little read coverage filtered prior pattern-matching. ProActive() filters contigs/chunks least 10x coverage total 5,000 bp across whole contig/chunk. read coverage filtering done way avoid filtering long contigs/chunks small elevations read coverage might get removed filtering done read coverage averages medians. Additionally, contigs/chunks less 30,000 bp filtered default, however can changed minContigLength parameter can set minimum 25,000 bp. like reduce size input metagenome pileup file ProActive(), consider pre-filtering assembly contigs greater 25,000 bp prior read mapping!

title: ProActive
text: input pileup files 100 bp windows mapped read coverage averaged . ProActive() increases window size prior pattern-matching averaging read coverages value specified windowSize. many cases, read coverage patterns don’t require resolution 100 bp windows provide, however, starting 100 bp windowSize means higher resolution available needed. users can use 100 bp windowSize ProActive(), processing time increased significantly noisy data may interfere pattern-matching. find default 1,000 bp windowSize provides nice balance processing time read coverage pattern resolution. ’d like resolution 1,000 bp windowSize provides, consider dropping windowSize 500. ’d like fine scale read coverage resolution, consider viewing contigs/genome Integative Genomics Viewer IGV

title: ProActive
text: ProActive() detects read coverage patterns using pattern-matching algorithm. Several predefined patterns, described , built using specific length read coverage values contig/chunk assessed. Patterns translated across contig/chunk 1,000 bp sliding windows translation, pattern-match score calculated taking mean absolute difference read coverage pattern values. smaller match-score, better pattern-match. pattern fully translated across contig/chunk, certain aspects pattern changed (.e. height, base, width) translation repeated. process translation pattern re-scaling repeated large number pattern variations tested. pattern-matching complete, pattern associated best match-score used contig/chunk classification. Contigs/chunks classified ‘Elevation’, ‘Gap’, ‘NoPattern’ pattern-matching.

title: ProActive
text: ‘elevation’ class defined ‘block’ pattern represents read covarage pattern formed reads highly active/abundant MGE map back respective integration site host/originating genome. pattern-matching, height (max), base (min) width altered pattern variations translated across contig/chunk. block pattern width never get smaller 10,000 bp default, however can changed minSize parameter.

title: ProActive
text: ‘gap’ class essentially reverse ‘elevation’ pattern. defined gapped block pattern represents depression read coverage caused genetic heterogeneity specific region leading poor read mapping. pattern-matching steps (alteration pattern pattern translation) used elevation pattern used gap pattern.

title: ProActive
text: Elevations gaps trail one side contig/chunk hard classify read coverage seen gap elevation depending ’re looking . solution problem classify contig/chunk ‘gap’ elevated region greater 50% length contig/chunk. Otherwise classification ‘elevated’.

title: ProActive
text: Since best pattern-match contig/chunk determined comparing match-scores amongst pattern-variations pattern classes, needed ‘negative control’ pattern compare . ‘NoPattern’ ‘pattern’ serves negative control matching contigs/chunks read coverage patterns. made two NoPattern patterns consist horizontal line length contig/chunk assessed either contig/chunk’s average median read coverage. pattern re-scaled translated way.

what: Extracting gene annotations in elevated/gapped regions
title: ProActive
text: .gff file provided, ProActive() extract gene predictions found within gapped elevated pattern-match regions provide user output table (ORFtable). additional column added classification information (gap elevation) associated gene predictions. input .gff file contains gene ‘product’ field attributes column (9th column dataframe), ProActive() extract product information separate column easy visualization filtering annotations interest.

title: ProActive
text: Default arguments metagenome mode: Default arguments genome mode: Note ProActive can run without gffTSV file!
code: ProActiveOutputMetagenome <- ProActive(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   mode = "metagenome",   gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 1.93secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>         3         3         1 ProActiveOutputGenome <- ProActive(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   mode = "genome",   gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 29.9secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>        25         3        21

title: ProActive
text: pileup: .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. mode: Either “genome” “metagenome” gffTSV: Optional, .gff file (TSV) containing gene predictions associated .fasta file used generate pileup. windowSize: number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. minSize: minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize: maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). minContigLength: minimum contig/chunk size (bp) perform pattern-matching . Default 25000. chunkSize: mode=“genome” mode=“metagenome” chunkContigs=TRUE, chunk genome contigs, respectively, smaller subsets pattern-matching. chunkSize determines size (bp) ‘chunk’. Default 50000. chunkContigs: TRUE FALSE, TRUE mode=“metagenome”, contigs longer chunkSize ‘chunked’ smaller subsets pattern-matching performed subset. Default FALSE. IncludeNoPatterns: TRUE FALSE, TRUE noPattern pattern-matches included ProActive PatternMatches output list. like visualize noPattern pattern-matches plotProActiveResults(), set TRUE. saveFilesTo: Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.
code: ProActive(pileup,   mode,   gffTSV,   windowSize = 1000,   minSize = 10000,   maxSize = Inf,   minContigLength = 30000,   chunkSize = 50000,   chunkContigs = FALSE,   IncludeNoPatterns = FALSE,   saveFilesTo )

title: ProActive
text: output ProActive list containing 6 objects: SummaryTable: table containing pattern-matching classifications CleanSummaryTable: table containing gap elevation pattern-match classifications (.e. noPattern classifications removed) PatternMatches: list object containing information needed visualize pattern-matches plotProActiveResults() FilteredOut: table containing contigs/chunks filtered small low read coverage Arguments: list object containing arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs) GenePredictTable: table containing gene predictions associated elevated gapped regions pattern-matches Save desired list item new variable using associated name. Metagenome results summary table: Subset genome results summary table: Subset GenePredictTable metagenome results:       Subset GenePredictTable genome results:

what: Plotting read coverage and associated pattern-matches

title: ProActive
text: Default arguments: Note- need set ‘genome’ ‘metagenome’ mode. plotProActiveResults() get information output ProActive().
code: MetagenomeResultsPlots <- plotProActiveResults(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputMetagenome )  GenomeResultsPlots <- plotProActiveResults(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   ProActiveResults = ProActiveOutputGenome )

title: ProActive
text: pileup: .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. ProActiveResults: output ProActive(). elevFilter: Optional, plot results pattern-matches achieved elevation ratio (max/min) greater specified values. Default NA (.e. filter). saveFilesTo: Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.

what: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage
text: ProActive R package automatically detects regions gapped elevated read coverage using pattern-matching algorithm. ProActive can detect, characterize visualize read coverage patterns genomes metagenomes. Optionally, users may provide gene predictions associated genome metagenome form .gff file. case, ProActive generate additional output table containing gene predictions found within detected regions gapped elevated read coverage. ProActive best used screening method identify genetic regions investigation. Elevations gaps read coverage can caused differential abundance specific genetic elements. example, elevation read coverage may caused prophage activation. prophage activates enters lytic cycle, genome begins replicating ratio phage:bacterial genomes cell begins increase. phage genomes bacterial genomes, sequencing phage reads generated bacterial. reads mapped back associated reference sequence, read coverage prophage region elevated comparison read coverage bacterial genome either side prophage. principle applies temperate phage highly abundant environment well mobile genetic elements freely present environment higher ratio originating ‘host’ genome. Conversely, gap read coverage may indicate genetic heterogeneity associated bacterial population. Genetic variants without specific genetic elements, like prophage certain genes, produce differential abundances sequencing reads may form read coverage gaps. formation read coverage gaps due genetic variants dependent assembly (.e. assembler assembles genetic variants separate entities ). Gaps read coverage may also form regions high mutation rates.

title: Detect Elevations and Gaps in Mapped Sequencing Read Coverage

Pileup files can used generate rolling mean read coverages associated base pair positions reduces data size preserving read coverage patterns. ProActive requires input pileups files generated using 100 bp window/bin size. Pileup files can generated either mapping sequencing reads either metagenome genome fasta. Read mapping performed using high minimum identity (0.97 higher) random mapping ambiguous reads. pileup files needed ProActive generated using .bam files produced read mapping. read mappers, like BBMap, allow generation pileup files bbmap.sh command use bincov output covbinsize=100 parameter/argument. Otherwise, BBMap’s pileup.sh can convert .bam files produced read mapper pileup files compatible ProActive using bincov output binsize=100.

code: library(ProActive)  MetagenomeProActive <- ProActive(   pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,   mode = "metagenome",   gffTSV = sampleMetagenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 2.17secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>         3         3         1  MetagenomePlots <- plotProActiveResults(pileup = sampleMetagenomePileup,                                         ProActiveResults = MetagenomeProActive) GenomeProActive <- ProActive(   pileup = sampleGenomePileup,   mode = "genome",   gffTSV = sampleGenomegffTSV ) #> Preparing input file for pattern-matching... #> Starting pattern-matching... #> A quarter of the way done with pattern-matching #> Half of the way done with pattern-matching #> Almost done with pattern-matching! #> Summarizing pattern-matching results #> Finding gene predictions in elevated or gapped regions of read coverage... #> Finalizing output #> Execution time: 35.96secs #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on low read coverage #> 0 contigs were filtered out based on length (< minContigLength) #>  #> Elevation       Gap NoPattern  #>        25         3        21  GenomePlots <- plotProActiveResults(pileup = sampleGenomePileup,                                     ProActiveResults = GenomeProActive)

Controller function for full elevation/gap pattern-matching — fullElevGap
text: pileupSubset subset pileup pertains contig/chunk currently assessed. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. minSize minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). elevOrGap Pattern-matching 'elevation' 'gap' pattern.

title: Builds pattern-match vectors — patternBuilder
text: Builds pattern-match (vector) associated contig/chunk visualization.

text: pileupSubset subset pileup pertains contig/chunk currently assessed. bestMatchList list containing pattern-match information associated contigs/chunks classified `ProActive()` pattern-matching

title: Controller function for pattern-matching — patternMatcher
text: Creates pileupSubset, representative one contig/chunk, used input individual pattern-matching function. information associated best match pattern obtained, pattern-match lowest mean absolute difference (match-score) used classification.

title: Controller function for pattern-matching — patternMatcher
code: patternMatcher(pileup, windowSize, minSize, maxSize, mode, minContigLength)

title: Controller function for pattern-matching — patternMatcher
text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . minSize minimum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default 10000. maxSize maximum size (bp) elevation gap patterns. Default NA (.e. maximum). mode Either "genome" "metagenome". minContigLength minimum contig/chunk size (bp) perform pattern-matching . Default 25000.

title: Full elevation/gap pattern translator — patternTranslator
text: Translates full elevation/gap patterns across contigs/chunks 1000bp time. Translation stops elevation pattern 5000bp end contig/chunk.

title: Full elevation/gap pattern translator — patternTranslator
text: contigCov read coverages pertain pileupSubset bestMatchInfo information associated current best pattern-match contig/chunk assessed. windowSize number basepairs average read coverage values . Options 100, 200, 500, 1000 . Default 1000. pattern vector containing values associated pattern-match elevOrGap Pattern-matching 'elevation' 'gap' pattern.

text: pileup .txt file containing mapped sequencing read coverages averaged 100 bp windows/bins. mode Either "genome" "metagenome"

title: Plot results of `ProActive()` pattern-matching — plotProActiveResults

ProActiveResults output `ProActive()`. elevFilter Optional, plot results pattern-matches achieved elevation ratio (max/min) greater specified values. Defualt NA (.e. filter). saveFilesTo Optional, Provide path directory wish save output . folder made within provided directory store results.

title: sampleGenomePileup — sampleGenomePileup
text: <https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25608871/>

title: sampleGenomePileup — sampleGenomePileup
text: dataset generated extracting DNA culture *Salmonella enterica* LT2 (LT2) infected phage P22. DNA shotgun sequenced Illumina (paired-end mode, 150 bp reads). sequencing reads mapped LT2 reference genome (NCBI RefSeq NC_003197.2). bbmap.sh bincov parameter covbinsize=100 used create pileup file 100 bp windows.

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: <https://microbiomejournal.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40168-020-00935-5>

title: sampleMetagenomePileup — sampleMetagenomePileup
text: dataset generated conventional mouse fecal homogenate. whole-community extracted DNA sequenced Illumina (paired-end mode, 150 bp reads) metagenome assembled. sequencing reads mapped assembled contigs using BBMap. bbmap.sh bincov parameter covbinsize=100 used create pileup file 100 bp windows. subset 10 contigs pileup file selected sample dataset. contigs chosen associated read coverage patterns exemplify ProActive's pattern-matching characterization functionality across classifications: NODE_1911: elevation left NODE_1583: elevation right NODE_1884: gap right NODE_1255: gap left NODE_368: full gap NODE_617: elevation full NODE_1625: pattern

title: sampleMetagenomeResults — sampleMetagenomeResults
text: Sample output running `ProActive()` metagenome mode Report...

title: sampleMetagenomeResults — sampleMetagenomeResults
text: ## `sampleMetagenomeResults` list 6 items: SummaryTable table containing pattern-matching classifications CleanSummaryTable table containing gap elevation pattern-match classifications (.e. noPattern classifications removed) PatternMatches list object containing information needed visualize pattern-matches `plotProActiveResults()` FilteredOut table containing contigs/chunks filtered small low read coverage Arguments list object containing arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs) GenePredictsTable list object containing arguments used pattern-matching (windowSize, mode, chunkSize, chunkContigs)
